      • onMapReady

        public void onMapReady(com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap googleMap)
        Manipulates the map once available. This callback is triggered when the map is ready to be used. This is where we can add markers or lines, add listeners or move the camera. If Google Play services is not installed on the device, the user will be prompted to install it inside the SupportMapFragment. This method will only be triggered once the user has installed Google Play services and returned to the app.

      • setMapType

        public void setMapType()

      • buildGoogleApiClient

        protected void buildGoogleApiClient()
        Builds a GoogleApiClient. Uses the addApi method to request the LocationServices API.

      • createLocationRequest

        protected void createLocationRequest()
        Sets up the location request. Android has two location request settings: ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION and ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION These settings control the accuracy of the current location. This sample uses ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION, as defined in the AndroidManifest.xml. When the ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION setting is specified, combined with a fast update interval (5 seconds), the Fused Location Provider API returns location updates that are accurate to within a few feet

      • startLocationUpdates

        public void startLocationUpdates()
        Requests location updates from the FusedLocationApi

      • stopLocationUpdates

        public void stopLocationUpdates()
        Removes location updates from the FusedLocationApi.
